intro: Cissus sicyoides f. compressicaulis, commonly known as the compact form of the glossy trumpet creeper, is a unique variant of the species characterized by its densely packed, slender stems. It belongs to the family Vitaceae, known for its climbing vines, and exhibits opposite, heart-shaped leaves with a waxy, glossy surface. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, followed by bright red berries that are edible for humans but toxic to livestock. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
